page.title: 05Interviewing Miss Catterall
page.content: She has lived in Tilstock for 72 years.Miss Reads shop was a malt-mill. There were 3 pubs, The Red Lion, St. Vincent and the present pub The Horseshoes. Most of the village people worked on farms.There were sheds and a field where the car-park is now, opposite was a building called The Old Post-Office were ropes were made.The Smithy was in front of the Horseshoes and behind it the fire station. When she started school it was morning's only and the infants had the small room and sat on platforms like stairs.The older pupils had the large room and there was a stove in the middle of the room.The School House was joined to the school through its own doorway.There were no proper toilets at the school and no large playground.The original windows are still in place.This is now the
